{{also|Verboten|verböten}} ==English== ===Etymology=== {{PIE root|en|bʰewdʰ}} Borrowed from {{bor|en|de|verboten||forbidden}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{a|UK}} {{IPA|en|/ˌvɜː(ɹ)ˈbəʊ.tən/}} * {{a|US}} {{IPA|en|/ˌfə(ɹ)ˈboʊ.tən/|/ˌvə(ɹ)ˈboʊ.tən/}} ===Adjective=== {{en-adj|-}} # [[forbidden|Forbidden]], [[prohibited]]. #* {{quote-web |en |date=2015-02-27 |author=Laura Kipnis |title=Sexual Paranoia Strikes Academe |work=The Chronicle of Higher Education |url=https://www.chronicle.com/article/sexual-paranoia-strikes/190351 |passage=Before that, students and professors could date whomever we wanted; the next day we were off-limits to one another—'''verboten''', traife, dangerous (and perhaps, therefore, all the more alluring).}} #* {{quote-web |en |date=2018-08-02 |author=Kara Swisher |authorlink=Kara Swisher |title=The Expensive Education of Mark Zuckerberg and Silicon Valley |work=New York Times |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/08/02/opinion/the-expensive-education-of-mark-zuckerberg-and-silicon-valley.html |passage=Or was it because he has since been steeped in the relentless positivity of Silicon Valley, where it is '''verboten''' to imagine a bad outcome?}} ====Usage notes==== A {{glossary|loanword}} with connotations of excessive strictness or authoritarianism, derived from perceptions of Germany, especially under the {{w|German Empire}} and {{w|Nazi Germany|National Socialism}}. ===Anagrams=== * {{anagrams|en|a=beenortv|overbent}} ---- ==German== ===Etymology=== {{PIE root|de|bʰewdʰ}} Past participle of {{m|de|verbieten}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/fɛɐ̯ˈboːtn̩/|/fɛɐ̯ˈboːtən/}} * {{audio|de|De-verboten.ogg|Audio}} ===Adjective=== {{de-adj|-}} # [[forbidden]], [[prohibited]], [[banned]] #* '''1929''', [[w:Kurt Tucholsky|Kurt Tucholsky]], ''[[s:de:Das Lächeln der Mona Lisa (Sammelband)|Das Lächeln der Mona Lisa (Sammelband)]]'', [[w:Rowohlt|Ernst Rowohlt Verlag]], page 120: #*: Für die Massen ist die Nation der Inbegriff alles Mystischen, Imponderabilen, schlechthin Unbegreiflichen – auf diesem Gebiet ist alles erlaubt und kann alles '''verboten''' sein, hier wachsen die großen Männer, deren Größe an der Kleinheit der Umstehenden gemessen wird. #*:: For the masses the nation is the embodiment of all that is mystical, imponderable, plainly incomprehensible – in this area everything is allowed and everything can be forbidden, here the great men grow, whose greatness is measured against the smallness of the bystanders. ====Declension==== {{de-decl-adj-notcomp|verboten}} ===Verb=== {{head|de|verb forms}} #
